paper_abstract: A Galerkin-characteristics finite element scheme of lumped mass type is presented for the convection-diffusion problems. Under the weakly acute triangulation hypothesis the scheme is proved to be stable and convergent in the L(infinity)-norm. Using the Freefem, we show 2D and 3D numerical examples, which reflect the robustness of the scheme and the theoretical convergence result. Copyright (C) 2010 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Stability and convergence of a Galerkin-characteristics finite element scheme of lumped mass type
